remarks: Define the set of all circuits (in an undirected graph). According to Wikipedia ("Cycle (graph theory)", ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cycle_(graph_theory) , 3-Oct-2017):  "A circuit can be a closed walk allowing repetitions of vertices but not edges;"; according to Wikipedia ("Glossary of graph theory terms", ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glossary_of_graph_theory_terms, 3-Oct-2017):  "A circuit may refer to ... a trail (a closed tour without repeated edges), ...". Following Bollobas ("A trail whose endvertices coincide (a closed trail) is called a circuit.", see Definition of [Bollobas] p. 5.), a circuit is a closed trail without repeated edges.  So the circuit is also represented by the following sequence: p(0) e(f(1)) p(1) e(f(2)) ... p(n-1) e(f(n)) p(n)=p(0) (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Oct-2017.)
